title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Motivated graduate student seeking consulting opportunities. Aspiring applied statistician who loves to use statistical methods to empower people with insights for good stewardship.






Paper

Used ordinal regression and generalized linear models to understand relationships between nanoparticle coatings and bacterial inhibition.




Paper

Used generalized additive models to predict pairwise interference in a Dynamic Spectrum Access context.
Presented at the 2024 IEEE Texas Symposium on Wireless and Microwave Circuits and Systems (WMCS).








Harvard Dataverse

Edited and compiled material with Dr. Mandy Hering on her contributions to the NSF HDR–Data Science Corps project (Grant #1924146).




GitHub

Built forecasting models to predict quantity demanded for fast-moving consumer goods in Indonesia.
Presented poster at UIC’s 2022 Undergraduate Mathematics Symposium and the 2022 Wheaton College Homecoming STEM Poster Session.





Conducted variable selection using the Lahman baseball database to model ERA using regression analysis.
Built a single-layer neural network and radial SVR model in R.






PhD, Statistical Science — Baylor University, Waco, TX (2024–Pending)
M.S., Statistical Science — Baylor University, Waco, TX (2023–2024) GPA: 3.75/4.0
B.S., Applied Mathematics with Statistics; B.A., Economics — Wheaton College (2019–2023) Edman Presidential Scholarship GPA: 3.46/4.0




Software Tools: Docker, RStudio, Git/GitHub, reveal.js, Positron Software Languages: R, JAGS/Stan, Python, C, SAS, Stata, SQL, zsh, LaTeX, JavaScript, CSS, HTML Relevant Coursework: Bayesian Methods, Survival Analysis, Time Series, Theory of Statistics, Statistical Methods, Computational Statistics, Numerical Analysis, Linear Algebra for Data Analysis, Mathematical Statistics, Machine Learning, Probability Theory, Real Analysis, Harvard’s CS Introduction, Econometrics, Economics of Labor and Poverty







Conducts research with Dr. Mandy Hering with collaborators in urban water treatment and infrastructure.





Collaborated in the Statistical Consulting Center on interdisciplinary research.
TA for Computational Statistics (STA 4373/5373/6375).
Led four supplemental instruction sessions weekly for Introduction to Statistical Methods (STA 2381).





Taught and reviewed mathematics with students ranging from Algebra I to AP Statistics.





TA for Applied Machine Learning (MATH 465) and Probability Theory (MATH 363).
Graded weekly assignments and hosted help sessions.





Participated in biostatistics coursework at Duke Clinical Research Institute and NC State.
Completed a hackathon on myocardial infarction modeling. GitHub









Built a blog to keep supporters updated on mission work.
Taught English and sports in schools and at camps; supported local CB churches.
Trained incoming short-term mission teams.









Practiced six days a week and played 40+ games per season.





Awarded to one senior exemplifying Christ-like character, integrity, and passion for the gospel.


If you want this styled (e.g., two-column layout, icons, colors, spacing), I can generate a fully designed Quarto CV page as well.

title: Projects

title: Projects

title: Carson Slater
text:
I am a third-year graduate student in the Department of Statistical Science at Baylor University. I moved to Waco after completing my undergraduate studies at Wheaton College, where I played baseball for the Thunder. I proudly hail from Phoenix and will spend every second I can visiting northern Arizona.
Generally speaking, you can find me at Grace Church Waco on a given Sunday morning, and I’m always trying to find a way to go back to the Czech Republic to work with Křesťanská Akademie Mladých again.
Currently, I am learning many new statistical methods that will enable me to build predictive models, understand stochastic phenomena, and discover associations in our world.

title: Carson Slater
text:
Education
Baylor University | Waco, TX M.S. in Statistics | 2023 - 2024 GPA: 3.83/4.00 Activities: Baylor Sports Analytics Club (President)
Wheaton College (IL) | Wheaton, IL B.S. Applied Mathematics, B.A. Economics | 2019 - 2023 GPA: 3.46/4.00 Activities: Varsity Baseball, Sophomore Class Council

title: Carson Slater
text:
Experience
Graduate Assistant | Baylor University Aug 2023 - Present

Currently, I am a research assistant with Dr. Mandy Hering where we collaborate with a utility for a Major US city.
I consulted at Baylor University in the Statistical Consulting Center, and am a teaching assistant for both the undergraduate and graduate offerings of Computational Statistics (STA 4373/5373/6375) with Dr. David Kahle.
I have worked with Dr. Mandy Hering also with her on her contributions to the National Science Foundation Harnessing the Data Revolution: Data Science Corps project (Grant no. #1924146).
I have also worked as a graduate supplemental instructor for the Introduction to Statistical Methods course (STA 2381).

Intern | KAM (Křesťanská Akademie Mladých) June 2023 - Aug 2023
After support raising for four months, I spent two and a half months working for a youth missions organization in Central and Eastern Europe, called KAM. For this work I lived in Ostrava, CZ where I assisted local CB churches with youth outreach through camps where I taught English and sports. I also helped onboard short-term mission teams who joined us for camps.
Academic Coach | Wheaton Academy Jan 2023 - May 2023
In this role I met with students 1-on-1 per their request to teach, review, and sharpen their math skills. I met with students ranging in courses from Algebra I to AP Statistics to help them prepare for their exams, whether it’s ones for courses or AP exams.
Teaching Assistant | Wheaton College Aug 2022 - May 2023
I was the teaching assistant for Dr. Peter Jantsch in the fall of 2022 and spring of 2023. I hosted weekly help sessions for students to come in for extra help, and graded course homework. The courses I helped with were: - MATH 465: Applied Machine Learning - MATH 363: Probability Theory
